org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple

Class DefaultAuthenticationServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ietf.nea.pt.socket.simple.DefaultAuthenticationServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Authenticator

    public class DefaultAuthenticationServer
extends Object
implements Authenticator
    Default authentication implementation for a NAA. This implementation uses SASL for the authentication. Because a SASL authentication mechanism can only be executed once a new authenticator must be added for every connection that should be authenticated using this authenticator. The authenticator is not reusable!

      Constructors

      Creates a default server-side authenticator with a selection of supported SASL server-side mechanisms.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultAuthenticationServer

        public DefaultAuthenticationServer()
        Creates a default server-side authenticator with no supported SASL mechanisms.

      • DefaultAuthenticationServer

        public DefaultAuthenticationServer(SaslServerMechansims mechanisms)
        Creates a default server-side authenticator with a selection of supported SASL server-side mechanisms. All added SASL authentication mechanisms must not be completed or the connection establishment will fail at a later point!
        Parameters:
        mechanisms - the supported SASL server-side mechanisms

      • negotiateMechanisms

        private PtTlsMessageValueSaslMechanismSelection negotiateMechanisms(byte stage,
                                                          SocketMessenger wrappedSocket)
                                                             throws ValidationException,
                                                                    ConnectionException,
                                                                    SerializationException
        Executes the server-side mechanism negotiation protocol flow.
        Parameters:
        stage - the current authentication stage
        wrappedSocket - the message handler containing the socket for message transmission
        Returns:
        a list of the names for suitable mechanisms
        Throws:
        SerializationException - if an error occurs at message serialization
        ValidationException - if an error occurs at message parsing
        ConnectionException - if the connection is broken

      • executeAuthentication

        private void executeAuthentication(SaslServer saslServer,
                         byte[] initialMessage,
                         SocketMessenger wrappedSocket)
                            throws ValidationException,
                                   ConnectionException,
                                   SerializationException,
                                   SaslException
        Executes the server-side authentication protocol flow using a chosen SASL mechanism.
        Parameters:
        saslServer - the chosen SASL server-side mechanism to use for the authentication
        initialMessage - an optional initial message provided by the client
        wrappedSocket - the message handler containing the socket for message transmission
        Throws:
        SerializationException - if an error occurs at message serialization
        ValidationException - if an error occurs at message parsing
        ConnectionException - if the connection is broken
        SaslException - if SASL authentication fails

        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if the contained error is fatal
